title: Juul Labs Names New CFO Amid Wider Management Reshuffle
text:
Embattled e-cigarette maker Juul Labs Inc. said Tuesday it has appointed a new chief financial officer amid a wider management shuffle.

San Francisco-based Juul named Guy Cartwright as finance chief. He succeeds Tim Danaher, who had asked to leave the company, according to a statement issued by Juul.

Mr. Cartwright joined Juul in July as its transformation and operations officer after nearly nine years as operating partner and managing director at investment firm TowerBrook Capital Partners LP.

“Over the past 3 months, Guy has been instrumental in helping us define our financial priorities and identify opportunities for efficiency,” Juul said in an emailed statement.

The CFO change follows the hiring last month of a new chief executive, K.C. Crosthwaite. The company is preparing to cut hundreds of jobs, The Wall Street Journal previously reported, amid a continuing investigation by the U.S. Federal Trade Commission into its marketing, as well as a proposed U.S. ban on flavors that comprise a majority of its sales and general concerns over vaping-related illnesses.

Juul’s products haven’t been linked to the illnesses, but a recent federal warning to stop using all vaping products has hurt sales.

Mr. Danaher had been with Juul CFO for five years. The company didn’t provide additional details about his departure.

“Tim [Danaher] helped build this company from the ground up and has done a tremendous job creating a financial structure that positions us for long-term growth,” Juul said in a statement.

Juul also confirmed Tuesday that Chief Marketing Officer Craig Brommers—the company’s first—would leave the company and that the position would be eliminated.
